intro: Pavetta barteri, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds. Pavetta barteri is often found in woodland or savanna habitats and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
